member.summary: Create a DBL Bundle

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Bundle`2.DefaultLanguageIsoCode
member.summary: Typically, this should be set to SIL.WritingSystems.WellKnownSubtags.UnlistedLanguage by the client. We would have probably just hard-coded to that, but we didn't want to have to reference SIL.WritingSystems just for that. Anyway, this gives a bit more versatility.

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Bundle`2.BundlePath
member.summary: Path to the original (unzipped) DBL bundle

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Bundle`2.Metadata
member.summary: Representation of the metadata.xml file included in the bundle

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Bundle`2.Id
member.summary: Unique hex ID for the DBL bundle

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Bundle`2.LanguageIso
member.summary: 3-letter ISO 639-2 code for the language of the DBL bundle. If the metadata's language does not identify an ISO 639-2 code, this returns the default language ISO code, which clients are encouraged to set to "qaa" or some other value that will allow it to be properly treated as "unknown".

member.summary: Identification for a DBL bundle

member.summary: Text representation for the DBL bundle

member.name: T:SIL.DblBundle.Text.DblMetadataLanguage
member.summary: Information about the language used in a Digital Bible Library bundle.

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Text.DblMetadataLanguage.Iso
member.summary: ISO 639-2 code for the language

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Text.DblMetadataLanguage.Name
member.summary: Language name

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Text.DblMetadataLanguage.Ldml
member.summary: Unicode language identifier. Not required, but may be needed in order to distinguish the language of the scripture text from a text in the same language,but from another region, or using another writing system (e.g. en-US vs en-GB). Paratext generated DBL text bundles are supplied this value from the ‘Language Identifier’ field of the selected project’s properties.

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Text.DblMetadataLanguage.Rod
member.summary: Dialect code taken from the Harvest Information Sysyems (HIS) Registry of Dialects (ROD). A ROD code may be needed(in addition to language/ldml) in order to distinguish the specific dialect of the language of the scripture text from others within the DBL. References: http://globalrecordings.net/research/rod

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Text.DblMetadataLanguage.Script
member.summary: Script used for the writing system

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Text.DblMetadataLanguage.ScriptDirection
member.summary: Direction in which script is written (LTR or RTL)

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Text.DblMetadataLanguage.Numerals
member.summary: Preferred numbering system to use for rendering digits in the scripture text. Publishers should use this information for providing the correct presentation of chapter and verse numbers, which are always provided in USX <chapter> and <verse> ‘num’ attributes in Arabic script.

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Text.DblMetadataLanguage.DisplayName
member.summary: Name of language displayed in the UI

member.name: M:SIL.DblBundle.Text.DblMetadataLanguage.ToString
member.summary: Text representation of bundle language

member.summary: Information about the project copyright for the DBL bundle

member.summary: Indicates the specific content format which this element contains.

member.summary: Contains child elements for supplying long, short, and abbr (abbreviation) vernacular names for Biblical books in the scripture text.

member.summary: Constructor for a DBL bundle book

member.summary: Three-letter book code for book

member.summary: Vernacular text for the long form of the name for the Biblical book.

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Text.Book.ShortName
member.summary: Vernacular text for the shorter form of the name for the Biblical book. This is the text typically used for the running header reference text in a printed volume, or for the text to appear for the book name in a digital navigation (menu) system.

member.name: P:SIL.DblBundle.Text.Book.Abbreviation
member.summary: Vernacular text for the abbreviated form of the name for the Biblical book. This is the text typically used within reference lists found in cross references, indexes, or concordances.
